text: if insurance companies are going to be
accurate about how we pay for care we
need to have as much
knowledge um as the providers of that
care so that we can make informed
decisions that are in the best interest
of patients so having done my PhD in the
'90s I realized that my genetics and
genomics knowledge was outdated and so
Stanford represented the best
opportunity to refresh that training and
build on
it genetics just as an example of all
medicine is advancing so quickly and so
it's important to know how to dig very
specifically into not just a disease in
an individual but dig into that
individual itself so the Stanford
genetics program by Illuminating
individual
within genetics and within genetic
expression helps us as both providers
and payers in our journey to deliver
individualized
care I am now considered the subject
matter expert for the policies which
determine the use of genetics for the
largest American Insurance company and I
would never have been able to reach that
without this course
